creator: arpitarora3000@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 32625
The screenshot shows where the file shoul be getting created but it is not there.

After restarting tomcat the .java file is not getting created in "D:\Program Files (x86)\SAP BusinessObjects\tomcat\work\Catalina\localhost\BOE\proxytemp\InfoView\org\apache\jsp" folder and along with that also in "D:\Program Files (x86)\SAP BusinessObjects\tomcat\work\Catalina\localhost\BOE\proxytemp\OpenDocument\org\apache\jsp\opendoc" and it may be that for other applications also. I made some changes in production server and then restarted tomcat server after clearing the cache. But after restarting tomcat the .java file is not getting created and it may be the reason that the changes are not getting reflected because of that. Kindly look into this with priority as the business is getting affected as no customized functionality can be restored back.

creator: markt@apache.org
text: Bugzilla is not a support forum. Please use the User's mailing list. If you have a support contract with SAP you may wish to contact them.

creator: arpitarora3000@gmail.com
text: We have a contract with SAP for support but the issue is there for Apache tomcat server so I think you should be providing a solution for this.
